seller_statement: Just tell me the number you’re offering.
response: Of course — I want to make sure the number makes sense for both of us, and that I’ve got enough info to make a strong offer the first time. Let me ask you a couple quick things to make sure it’s accurate.
follow_up_prompt: Can I confirm the interior condition — are we talking cosmetic updates or more structural stuff?

seller_statement: I’m done talking. Don’t bother calling again.
response: Understood — I don’t want to bother you if it’s not something you want to explore. Before I go, would it be alright if I left my info in case you change your mind later?
follow_up_prompt: If things shift and you decide to revisit selling, would you be open to a conversation down the line?

seller_statement: Hey! Yeah, I’ve been meaning to call someone about this place.
response: Perfect timing then. I’d love to learn more about it and see if we might be a fit to help. Can I ask you a couple questions about the house first?
follow_up_prompt: What made you decide now is the right time to explore selling?

seller_statement: Well… I might sell, I’m just not sure yet.
response: Totally fair — this is a big decision. No pressure on my end, I just want to see if we might be a good fit. If not, no hard feelings.
follow_up_prompt: What would need to happen for selling to make sense for you right now?

seller_statement: I’m ready to get rid of it. Just want a clean deal.
response: You’re speaking my language. That’s exactly how we operate — no games, no nickel-and-diming. Just a clear offer and a fast close.
follow_up_prompt: Can we talk about timeline — what’s your ideal move-out or closing window?

seller_statement: I’ve had bad experiences in the past with investors not following through.
response: Totally fair — I hear that more often than you’d think. Can I ask, was it that they made an offer and then backed out, or something else that rubbed you the wrong way?
follow_up_prompt: Assuming we’re fully transparent and follow through exactly how we lay things out, what would make you feel more comfortable moving forward with someone like us?

seller_statement: I’m not sure when I’ll be ready to sell.
response: That’s okay — there’s no rush on my end unless it benefits you. Most people I talk to aren’t 100% ready either, but they just want to explore options.
follow_up_prompt: If you had to guess, are we talking more like a few weeks, a couple months, or is it more of a ‘wait and see’ situation?

seller_statement: That sounds too low for this house.
response: I understand — and I’d probably feel the same if I didn’t know how these offers were built. Just out of curiosity, what number were you hoping to hear?
follow_up_prompt: If I could walk you through how we arrived at our offer — comps, repairs, investor costs — would you at least be open to seeing the breakdown?

seller_statement: Just make me an offer — I don’t need to answer all these questions.
response: Totally get that — and I’d love to. The only reason I ask is because the more I understand, the better I can tailor something that makes sense for you, not just a random lowball.
follow_up_prompt: Is there a ballpark number that would feel like a win for you, assuming everything checks out?

seller_statement: I don’t want to list it. I thought you were buying it directly.
response: Absolutely — we’re not agents, and we don’t list anything. What we do is structure offers so it’s fast, direct, and simple — no open houses, fees, or repairs needed.
follow_up_prompt: Have you had experience listing a property before, or are you just trying to avoid that whole process altogether?

seller_statement: This sounds too good to be true.
response: Fair — I’d probably say the same thing if I were in your shoes. There’s definitely a lot of noise out there. That’s why I like to just walk through how it works, no fluff.
follow_up_prompt: Would it be helpful if I laid out step-by-step how this actually goes, so you can judge for yourself?

seller_statement: I’m waiting to hear back from another company.
response: Got it — totally respect that. Are you just comparing options right now or is there a front-runner you’re leaning toward?
follow_up_prompt: If we were able to match or even beat what they’re offering, would it make sense to move forward with us instead?

seller_statement: I need to figure out where I’m moving before I sell.
response: Completely understandable — that’s actually one of the most common things we help sellers work through. Selling and moving at the same time is stressful.
follow_up_prompt: If we could work on your timeline and even allow some flexibility after closing, would that take some pressure off?

category: Needs to Talk to Someone Else
seller_statement: I need to talk to my spouse/family first.
response: Absolutely — I wouldn’t expect you to make a big decision without looping them in. Most people do the same.
follow_up_prompt: Would it be helpful if we hopped on a quick call with them together, or should I just follow up after you’ve had that conversation?

seller_statement: I’m thinking of listing with an agent.
response: That makes sense — if you’re trying to squeeze every dollar out and don’t mind the time and prep involved, listing can work well in the right market.
follow_up_prompt: Can I ask what has you leaning that way — is it purely price, or something else that feels more comfortable about that route?
